Job Desception:
About the job
            

 
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?Are you a full-stack engineer who thrives on complex challenges and is eager to make a real impact? Join our team to contribute to innovative products that deeply leverage AI and that are reshaping industries and changing the way we work and learn.Our strategic product line includes: Crossover: An AI-powered hiring platform that sifts through millions of applicants per year to find the top 1% of global remote talent, making high-paying jobs accessible to professionals worldwide, regardless of their location.gt.school: An online education platform that uses advanced data collection, algorithms, and AI-generated content to empower students learn at their own pace. Our adaptive learning system fills knowledge gaps, accelerates learning, and helps students quickly master a whole grade level on a subject within weeks.Data-driven Sales: This initiative leverages data and AI algorithms to streamline the sales process across a portfolio of over 100 software products. We're transitioning these products to a unified platform based on Salesforce and NetSuite, all while handling complex data imports, modeling divergences and data synchronization.
What we offer: The opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies, including the latest in Angular, AWS serverless and no-code/low-code patterns.The opportunity to learn and experiment with using generative AI to boost your productivity.A team of exceptionally talented engineers from around the world as your peers.The chance to work on products that are making a real difference in people's lives.
We're not just using AI as a buzzword. We're at the start of a thrilling journey with generative AI, experimenting and learning to fully leverage its potential and free our engineers from mundane tasks, allowing them to focus on what truly matters: design, decision-making, and understanding the far-reaching implications of different implementation strategies.Showcase your skills, not just your resume. Take on our challenges: 15-min Cognitive, 90-min Coding, 180-min Technical Decision-Making. Excel and you'll face a decisive interview with our Hiring Manager. More than half walk away with an offer. Ready to unleash your potential? Apply today!What You Will Be Doing Building modern web apps using Angular accompanied by top-notch libraries and tools.Enhancing cloud-native backends using the latest serverless cloud patterns, including AWS.Reviewing code to ensure adherence to best practices, team standards, and customer requirements.
What You Won’t Be Doing Spending time on minor bug fixes or features in outdated codebases.Dealing with tedious infrastructure to keep poorly written products running.Getting stuck in endless meetings discussing roadmaps and priorities or chasing people around.
Basic RequirementsFull Stack Developer key responsibilities At least 3 years of experience writing frontend code (any framework)At least 1 year of experience writing frontend code in Angular.At least 3 years of experience writing backend code (any framework).An openness to learn to use generative A.I. in your day-to-day development work.
Nice-to-have Requirements Experience in using generative A.I. in your day-to-day development work.
About TrilogyHundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!Working with CrossoverThis is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $50 USD/hour, which equates to $100,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.What to expect next: You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.
Important! If you do not receive an email from us: First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

Full Stack Development:●       Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including designers and project managers, to gather requirements and develop web applications that align with business needs.●       Design and implement user-friendly, responsive, and visually appealing front-end interfaces using HTML, CSS, PHP, JavaScript and Bootstrap frameworks.●       Develop back-end components and database structures using technologies like Laravel or similar, ensuring seamless integration with front-end functionalities.●       Develop and Implement APIs to facilitate communication between front-end and back-end systems.2. Application Architecture:●       Participate in the architectural decisions of web applications, choosing appropriate technologies and frameworks to achieve scalability, performance, and maintainability.●       Developing user-friendly and visually appealing interfaces, and performing SEO procedures.●       Integrating images, embedding videos, and adding plugins.●       Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs and optimize applications for maximum speed and scalability.●       Performing Common Gateway Interface (CGI) and code checks to optimize website performance.3. Database Management:●       Design and maintain database schemas, write efficient SQL queries, and ensure data integrity and security.●       Implement caching mechanisms and database optimizations to enhance application performance.4. Testing and Debugging:●       Write unit and integration tests to ensure the reliability and robustness of the applications.●       Identify and debug issues, and provide timely resolutions to ensure a smooth user experience.5. Continuous Improvement:●       Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices, and proactively recommend improvements to existing applications and development processes.●       Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback to team members.6. Deployment and Maintenance:●       Deploy applications to staging and production environments using modern deployment practices.●       Monitor application performance, identify bottlenecks, and take proactive measures to ensure optimal performance and uptime.●       Troubleshooting and testing prototypes, as well as monitoring the live deployment of the product.7. Collaboration and Communication:●       Consulting with internal stakeholders to determine the website's desired appearance and functionalities.●       Conceptualizing the website design process and leading the technical discussions.●       Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, including designers, product managers, and other developers, to achieve project goals.●       Communicate project progress, challenges, and solutions clearly to stakeholders.●       Documenting website development processes and procedures.Qualifications:●       Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience).●       Minimum of 2 to 3 years of professional experience in full stack WordPress development.●       Strong proficiency in front-end technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and modern front-end frameworks.●       Experience with back-end technologies.●       Proficiency in database design, SQL, and database management systems (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB).●       Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.●       Excellent communication and time management skills, with the ability to articulate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.If you are a proactive and skilled Full Stack WordPress Developer with a passion for creating impactful web applications, we encourage you to apply. Join our team and contribute to the growth and success of KWS Pakistan. Please submit your resume, portfolio, and any relevant code samples showcasing your work.

Job Title: Full Stack DeveloperEmployment Type: Full-timeExperience Level: Mid-level (5 years of experience)  We are currently seeking a talented Full Stack Developer with expertise in Typescript and Javascript, React, React Native, Next.js, Tailwind CSS, SCSS, Nest.js, TypeORM, Node.js, Express.js, and Postgres, and Oracle database to join our dynamic team. Job Description: As a Full Stack Developer, you will play a crucial role in building and maintaining web and applications that are both visually appealing and high-performing. You will work closely with our cross-functional teams to bring innovative solutions to life, leveraging your deep knowledge of both front-end and back-end technologies. Key Responsibilities:  Full Stack Development: Develop and maintain web applications, covering both front-end and back-end, ensuring they meet high standards of performance, security, and user experience. Front-End Development: Utilize your expertise in React, Next.js, Tailwind CSS, and SCSS to create visually stunning and responsive user interfaces.Back-End Development: Leverage your experience in Nest.js, TypeORM, Node.js, and Express.js and Nest.js to build robust and scalable server-side components.Database Management: Work with Oracle database to design, optimize, and maintain the database schema, ensuring data integrity and performance.Architecture and Design: Collaborate on architectural decisions and design patterns to create scalable and maintainable applications.Code Quality: Write unit tests, conduct code reviews, and adhere to best practices to maintain code quality and reliability.Collaboration: Collaborate closely with designers, product managers, and fellow developers to deliver high-quality solutions on time.
 ·        Node.js: A strong understanding of Node.js is fundamental. This includes asynchronous programming, event-driven architecture, and knowledge Java and TypeScript are crucial for both front-end and back-end development. Knowledge of modern JavaScript ES6+ features is essential.·        Server-Side Development: Expertise in building server-side applications using Node.js, including creating APIs, handling HTTP requests, and managing databases.·        Front-End Development: Proficiency in front-end technologies like HTML, CSS, and JavaScript frameworks (e.g., React, Angular, or Vue.js) to create responsive and interactive user interfaces.·        Express.js: Knowledge of Express.js, a popular web application framework for Node.js, is essential for building robust server-side applications.·        Database Management: Proficiency in working with databases, both relational (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL) and NoSQL (e.g., MongoDB). Understanding of database design and optimization is important.·        RESTful APIs: Ability to design and implement RESTful APIs for communication between the front-end and back-end systems.·        Web Security: Knowledge of web security best practices to protect against common vulnerabilities like XSS, CSRF, and SQL injection.·        Package Management: Familiarity with package managers like npm or yarn for managing project dependencies.·        Version Control: Proficiency in using version control systems like Git for tracking code changes and collaborating with other developers.·        Build Tools: Experience with build tools and task runners (e.g., Webpack, Gulp) to automate tasks like bundling, minification, and deployment.·        Testing and Debugging: Skill in writing unit tests, integration tests, and performing debugging using tools like Mocha, Chai, and Jest, or debugging tools provided by browsers and Node.js.·        Deployment and DevOps: Knowledge of deploying Node.js applications on web servers or cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Heroku). Understanding of containerization (e.g., Docker) and orchestration tools (e.g., Kubernetes) can also be beneficial.·        Performance Optimization: Ability to identify and address performance bottlenecks in both front-end and back-end code.·        Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD): Understanding of CI/CD pipelines to automate the testing and deployment of code changes.·        Agile Development: Familiarity with Agile methodologies and practices for efficient project management and collaboration.·        Soft Skills: Effective communication, problem-solving, and teamwork skills are important, as full-stack developers often work closely with other team members and stakeholders.·        Security: Awareness of security best practices and the ability to implement security measures to protect applications and data.·        Project Management: Familiarity with project management tools and methodologies can be beneficial for organizing and tracking work.·        DevOps and Cloud Services: Knowledge of cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud and how to leverage DevOps practices for infrastructure management and scaling applications. Employment TypeFull-time

The candidate should have a strong background in building web applications using Laravel and Vue.js, as well as experience with other modern front-end technologies.It’s an onsite PositionTimings: 04:00 PM to 01:00 AMLocation: Hybrid MediaWorks, First Floor, Plot # 176 Korang Road, near Rahat Bakers, I-10/3, Islamabad.Laravel Full Stack Developer Responsibilities:  Develop and maintain web applications using Laravel and Vue.js  Collaborate with designers, developers, and project managers to build responsive and user-friendly interfaces  Participate in code reviews and help improve code quality  Build reusable code and libraries for future use  Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code  Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and frameworks  Identify and resolve technical problems and bugs  Collaborate with other team members to define and implement features 
Requirements  At least 3 years of experience working as a full stack developer with Laravel and Vue.js  Proficient in PHP, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and MySQL  Experience with Laravel Blade and Vue.js templates  Strong understanding of MVC architecture and RESTful API design  Familiarity with Git version control system  Experience with unit testing, integration testing, and test-driven development  Knowledge of server administration and deployment using tools like AWS, Docker, and Kubernetes  Excellent communication and collaboration skills 
BenefitsWe know how important your career is to you. It’s important to us too! That’s why we have a clear and transparent career path. Through career progression Plans you can achieve your life goals as we partner your Dreams!!!At Hybrid Mediaworks rewards are more than just cash incentives. But our competitive basic salaries, personal and team-based bonuses and additional incentives are a great start.We regularly host team social events, and awards for going the extra mile – Few other benefits-  Cash Prizes  Monthly Team Meetups  Annual Dinner  Paid Leaves  Health Insurance  Bonuses

About the job
            

 
A U.S.-based company that is enhancing public defenders' capacity to examine this significant data with its evidence management software, is looking for a Full-Stack Engineer. The engineer will be responsible for releasing high-quality, worthwhile features as soon as possible so that clients can immediately start helping people get out of jail and receive a second chance. By helping lawyers effectively analyze a vast amount of data, the company is fostering greater accountability in the judicial system. The company has managed to secure more than $2.2mn during their Seed round of funding.Job Responsibilities: Implement user-facing features that will improve the platform's usability and value to public defendersAs the team relocates the back-end to better support the platform's machine learning capabilities, help to improve the editor's overall user experienceParticipate in frequent feedback meetings with public defenders where the team can learn what aspects of the platform are effective and what needs improvementEngage important players in our criminal justice system directly, and use their input to define a product roadmap for the companyContribute to the improvement of engineering excellence and efficiency Work closely with the UI components that integrate data from back-end REST API endpoints that have undergone design and development testingImplement UI/UX adjustments based on UI mocksRecognize how the platform's general architecture affects the front-endBy maintaining good code hygiene and applying optimal coding practices, technical debt can be decreasedBe driven by your own ambition and keen to contribute your ideas to the creation of the product roadmapMust be at ease developing unit tests and testable front-end code
Job Requirements: Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)At least 4+ years of relevant experience as a full-stack engineerDemonstrable experience working with tech stacks like React, Node.js, and JavaScript/TypeScriptProlific experience working with UI developmentIn-depth knowledge of more general web topics, such as CORS, REST requests, and web securityThorough understanding of design patterns and when to employ themNice to have some Natural Language Processing (NLP) Python and Machine Learning knowledgeFamiliarity with using the AWS console and Amazon Web Service is desirableExcellent English communication skills, both written and spoken

1 day ago

 · 48 applicants
employees: 5,001-10,000 employees · IT Services and IT Consulting
Job Desception:
About the job
            

 
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?Are you a full-stack engineer who thrives on complex challenges and is eager to make a real impact? Join our team to contribute to innovative products that deeply leverage AI and that are reshaping industries and changing the way we work and learn.Our strategic product line includes: Crossover: An AI-powered hiring platform that sifts through millions of applicants per year to find the top 1% of global remote talent, making high-paying jobs accessible to professionals worldwide, regardless of their location.gt.school: An online education platform that uses advanced data collection, algorithms, and AI-generated content to empower students learn at their own pace. Our adaptive learning system fills knowledge gaps, accelerates learning, and helps students quickly master a whole grade level on a subject within weeks.Data-driven Sales: This initiative leverages data and AI algorithms to streamline the sales process across a portfolio of over 100 software products. We're transitioning these products to a unified platform based on Salesforce and NetSuite, all while handling complex data imports, modeling divergences and data synchronization.
What we offer: The opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies, including the latest in Angular, AWS serverless and no-code/low-code patterns.The opportunity to learn and experiment with using generative AI to boost your productivity.A team of exceptionally talented engineers from around the world as your peers.The chance to work on products that are making a real difference in people's lives.
We're not just using AI as a buzzword. We're at the start of a thrilling journey with generative AI, experimenting and learning to fully leverage its potential and free our engineers from mundane tasks, allowing them to focus on what truly matters: design, decision-making, and understanding the far-reaching implications of different implementation strategies.Showcase your skills, not just your resume. Take on our challenges: 15-min Cognitive, 90-min Coding, 180-min Technical Decision-Making. Excel and you'll face a decisive interview with our Hiring Manager. More than half walk away with an offer. Ready to unleash your potential? Apply today!What You Will Be Doing Building modern web apps using Angular accompanied by top-notch libraries and tools.Enhancing cloud-native backends using the latest serverless cloud patterns, including AWS.Reviewing code to ensure adherence to best practices, team standards, and customer requirements.
What You Won’t Be Doing Spending time on minor bug fixes or features in outdated codebases.Dealing with tedious infrastructure to keep poorly written products running.Getting stuck in endless meetings discussing roadmaps and priorities or chasing people around.
Basic RequirementsFull Stack Engineer key responsibilities At least 3 years of experience writing frontend code (any framework)At least 1 year of experience writing frontend code in Angular.At least 3 years of experience writing backend code (any framework).An openness to learn to use generative A.I. in your day-to-day development work.
Nice-to-have Requirements Experience in using generative A.I. in your day-to-day development work.
About TrilogyHundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!Working with CrossoverThis is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $50 USD/hour, which equates to $100,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.What to expect next: You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.
Important! If you do not receive an email from us: First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

About the job
            

 
note: If you are not able to start right away, even as part-time, please refrain from submitting, While we often have average paced projects, this particular project is high energy, high paced and you will be expected to jump out the blocks fixing issues and working on new features as they are detected. If you are not able to hit the ground running until we finish the client launch cycle, please refrain from submitting. Those that submit and are considered, will need to complete a general test before you can gain an interview. The test is vague to get a feel for your logic, problem solving, and logical ways of providing solutions without being told. If you are not selected, please know there is only one open lead position, so the selection is not personal. We are looking for a certain range of skill-sets. Thank you!-------------------------Hello!We're on the lookout for a passionate and experienced Lead Full Stack Developer to join our remote development team. Someone who is focused on helping finalize our on-going projects, open to working weekends in the final release window, and directing and working with other team members. During normal development, you get to choose your own working hours. Someone who interested in growth opportunities with our company.As an integral member of our team, you'll be in the thick of things, intertwining both front-end design aesthetics with robust back-end database solutions. We're scaling up, and we need someone who can help us finalize our platform's user experience while ensuring our data structures remain solid and efficient. Someone who can work alone after instruction, deploy updates without issue, and work weekends during platform deploy schedules. We have several projects ending and a few starting so we are looking for someone to deep dive and really own this role.Responsibilities: Create, Deploy, Maintain environment on Digital Ocean (required)Create and Maintain reporting component from table data for client viewing and sharingAdd Designs, develop, and optimize our web-based platform, ensuring a seamless and responsive user experience based on visual examples.Offline mode for live service interruption.Strong React, JavaScript understanding and ability to address issues in a timely manner.Communicate regularly on assignments and asks questions.Manage and optimize database solutions, ensuring data integrity, security, and accessibility.Translate UI/UX design from layout to current code, bridging the gap between visual elements and technical implementation.Collaborate with a cross-functional team to define, design, and ship new features.Constantly explore, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency and improve performance.
Requirements: Proficient in TailwindProficiency in front-end languages, frameworks, and libraries (e.g., HTML/CSS, JavaScript, React, Vue.js, TypeScript).Strong experience with database technologies (e.g., MySQL, MongoDB, PostgreSQL) and understanding of database design and optimization principles.Familiarity with back-end languages (e.g., Python, Java, Node.js) and frameworks (e.g., Express, Django).Experience in integrating with APIs and understanding of RESTful services.Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and multi-task in a fast-paced environment.Effective communication skills, both written and verbal, to ensure seamless remote team collaboration.Fluent English proficiency for coherent communication and collaboration.
Preferred Qualifications: Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.Able to work weekends during project deploy and release windows( will get priority interview )Proven track record with a portfolio showcasing completed projects and contributions.Familiarity with CI/CD tools and best practices.50hrs minimum a week
We pride ourselves on being an equal opportunity employer, emphasizing the capabilities and results of our team members. We use a time-clock to track hours. Our compensation packages are competitive with project based bonus, personal completion bonus, end of year bonus (60days on team minimum), and service bonus every 4th week to help with software and other expenses, hourly based on monthly salary and paid out weekly, tailored according to the applicant's country region and expertise level. If you're a forward-thinker with a knack for blending design and functionality, we'd love to hear from you!To apply, please submit your resume, portfolio, and a brief introduction outlining your experience and relevant skills. Potential candidates will be shortlisted for an interview.

About the job
            

 
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?Are you a full-stack engineer who thrives on complex challenges and is eager to make a real impact? Join our team to contribute to innovative products that deeply leverage AI and that are reshaping industries and changing the way we work and learn.Our strategic product line includes: Crossover: An AI-powered hiring platform that sifts through millions of applicants per year to find the top 1% of global remote talent, making high-paying jobs accessible to professionals worldwide, regardless of their location.gt.school: An online education platform that uses advanced data collection, algorithms, and AI-generated content to empower students learn at their own pace. Our adaptive learning system fills knowledge gaps, accelerates learning, and helps students quickly master a whole grade level on a subject within weeks.Data-driven Sales: This initiative leverages data and AI algorithms to streamline the sales process across a portfolio of over 100 software products. We're transitioning these products to a unified platform based on Salesforce and NetSuite, all while handling complex data imports, modeling divergences and data synchronization.
What we offer: The opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies, including the latest in Angular, AWS serverless and no-code/low-code patterns.The opportunity to learn and experiment with using generative AI to boost your productivity.A team of exceptionally talented engineers from around the world as your peers.The chance to work on products that are making a real difference in people's lives.
We're not just using AI as a buzzword. We're at the start of a thrilling journey with generative AI, experimenting and learning to fully leverage its potential and free our engineers from mundane tasks, allowing them to focus on what truly matters: design, decision-making, and understanding the far-reaching implications of different implementation strategies.Showcase your skills, not just your resume. Take on our challenges: 15-min Cognitive, 90-min Coding, 180-min Technical Decision-Making. Excel and you'll face a decisive interview with our Hiring Manager. More than half walk away with an offer. Ready to unleash your potential? Apply today!What You Will Be Doing Building modern web apps using Angular accompanied by top-notch libraries and tools.Enhancing cloud-native backends using the latest serverless cloud patterns, including AWS.Reviewing code to ensure adherence to best practices, team standards, and customer requirements.
What You Won’t Be Doing Spending time on minor bug fixes or features in outdated codebases.Dealing with tedious infrastructure to keep poorly written products running.Getting stuck in endless meetings discussing roadmaps and priorities or chasing people around.
Basic RequirementsFull Stack Developer key responsibilities At least 3 years of experience writing frontend code (any framework)At least 1 year of experience writing frontend code in Angular.At least 3 years of experience writing backend code (any framework).An openness to learn to use generative A.I. in your day-to-day development work.
Nice-to-have Requirements Experience in using generative A.I. in your day-to-day development work.
About TrilogyHundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!Working with CrossoverThis is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $50 USD/hour, which equates to $100,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.What to expect next: You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.
Important! If you do not receive an email from us: First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

Job Desception:
About the job
            

 
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?Are you a full-stack engineer who thrives on complex challenges and is eager to make a real impact? Join our team to contribute to innovative products that deeply leverage AI and that are reshaping industries and changing the way we work and learn.Our strategic product line includes: Crossover: An AI-powered hiring platform that sifts through millions of applicants per year to find the top 1% of global remote talent, making high-paying jobs accessible to professionals worldwide, regardless of their location.gt.school: An online education platform that uses advanced data collection, algorithms, and AI-generated content to empower students learn at their own pace. Our adaptive learning system fills knowledge gaps, accelerates learning, and helps students quickly master a whole grade level on a subject within weeks.Data-driven Sales: This initiative leverages data and AI algorithms to streamline the sales process across a portfolio of over 100 software products. We're transitioning these products to a unified platform based on Salesforce and NetSuite, all while handling complex data imports, modeling divergences and data synchronization.
What we offer: The opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies, including the latest in Angular, AWS serverless and no-code/low-code patterns.The opportunity to learn and experiment with using generative AI to boost your productivity.A team of exceptionally talented engineers from around the world as your peers.The chance to work on products that are making a real difference in people's lives.
We're not just using AI as a buzzword. We're at the start of a thrilling journey with generative AI, experimenting and learning to fully leverage its potential and free our engineers from mundane tasks, allowing them to focus on what truly matters: design, decision-making, and understanding the far-reaching implications of different implementation strategies.Showcase your skills, not just your resume. Take on our challenges: 15-min Cognitive, 90-min Coding, 180-min Technical Decision-Making. Excel and you'll face a decisive interview with our Hiring Manager. More than half walk away with an offer. Ready to unleash your potential? Apply today!What You Will Be Doing Building modern web apps using Angular accompanied by top-notch libraries and tools.Enhancing cloud-native backends using the latest serverless cloud patterns, including AWS.Reviewing code to ensure adherence to best practices, team standards, and customer requirements.
What You Won’t Be Doing Spending time on minor bug fixes or features in outdated codebases.Dealing with tedious infrastructure to keep poorly written products running.Getting stuck in endless meetings discussing roadmaps and priorities or chasing people around.
Basic RequirementsFull Stack Developer key responsibilities At least 3 years of experience writing frontend code (any framework)At least 1 year of experience writing frontend code in Angular.At least 3 years of experience writing backend code (any framework).An openness to learn to use generative A.I. in your day-to-day development work.
Nice-to-have Requirements Experience in using generative A.I. in your day-to-day development work.
About TrilogyHundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!Working with CrossoverThis is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $50 USD/hour, which equates to $100,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.What to expect next: You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.
Important! If you do not receive an email from us: First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

About the job
            
 
We are seeking a highly skilled Full Stack Node.js Developer to join our development team. As a Full Stack Node.js Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining robust and scalable web applications using the Node.js framework. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including designers, DevOps, and product managers to deliver high-quality software solutions. We are looking for individuals who are competitive, driven, strong communicators, and consistently practice refining their skillset.  What You Will Do  Collaborate with and across Agile teams to design, develop, test, implement, and support technical solutions in full-stack development tools and technologies. Architect and develop scalable, efficient, and clean code following best practices and coding standards. Implement and integrate user interfaces with microservices. Develop and consume GraphQL APIs, and integrate third-party services and libraries. Perform unit testing, integration testing, and debugging to ensure software quality and reliability. Optimize application performance, scalability, and security. Conduct code reviews and provide constructive feedback to ensure code quality and adherence to standards. Mentor and guide junior developers, providing technical leadership and support. Troubleshoot and debug complex issues and provide timely resolutions. Stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in web development, MERN stack, and GraphQL. Collaborate with UI/UX designers to ensure seamless integration of design and functionality. Utilize programming languages like JavaScript, Java, HTML/CSS, TypeScript, SQL, Python, and Go, Open Source RDBMS and NoSQL databases, Container Orchestration services including Docker and Kubernetes, and a variety of AWS tools and services. Drive continuous improvement of development processes and workflows to enhance efficiency and productivity. Contribute to the technical roadmap and architectural decisions of projects. Share a passion for staying on top of tech trends, experimenting with and learning new technologies, participating in internal and external technology communities, and mentoring other members of the engineering community. 
What We’re Looking For  Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field. Minimum of 5 years of proven work experience as a Full Stack Node.js Developer, with a strong portfolio of web applications developed using the MERN stack and GraphQL. Expertise in JavaScript and a solid understanding of asynchronous programming and event-driven architectures. Strong proficiency and extensive experience with the MERN (MongoDB, Express.js, React.js, Node.js) stack. Deep understanding of GraphQL and experience in designing and implementing scalable GraphQL APIs. Strong experience with front-end technologies such as HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript frameworks (e.g., React, Angular, Vue.js). Solid understanding of database systems (e.g., MongoDB, MySQL, PostgreSQL) and experience with ORMs and query optimization. Proficient in version control systems (e.g., Git) and agile development methodologies. Experience with server deployment and management including cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure). Strong experience with testing frameworks (e.g., Mocha, Jest) and test-driven development (TDD). Exceptional problem-solving and debugging skills. Excellent leadership, communication, and collaboration abilities, with the ability to mentor and guide junior developers. Strong understanding of software development best practices, architecture, and design patterns. Proven track record of delivering high-quality, scalable web applications within deadlines. 
Company Overview Consforc LLC. is a Management Consulting & Technical Recruitment firm based out of Lahore, Pakistan specializing in meeting the unique staffing and consulting needs of companies in various industries. Our areas of expertise include technical recruitment, software development, IT consulting, and project management. Our Culture Our core is defined by the consistent effort that we put in to make dreams come true for everyone. We are a result-oriented organization and believe that results provide the real metrics for everyone’s success. Results come first, what-if comes later.

Crossover  · Islamabad, Islāmābād, Pakistan Reposted  
1 month ago
employees: 5,001-10,000 employees · IT Services and IT Consulting
Job Desception:
About the job
            
 
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?Are you a full-stack engineer who thrives on complex challenges and is eager to make a real impact? Join our team to contribute to innovative products that deeply leverage AI and that are reshaping industries and changing the way we work and learn.Our strategic product line includes: Crossover: An AI-powered hiring platform that sifts through millions of applicants per year to find the top 1% of global remote talent, making high-paying jobs accessible to professionals worldwide, regardless of their location.gt.school: An online education platform that uses advanced data collection, algorithms, and AI-generated content to empower students learn at their own pace. Our adaptive learning system fills knowledge gaps, accelerates learning, and helps students quickly master a whole grade level on a subject within weeks.Data-driven Sales: This initiative leverages data and AI algorithms to streamline the sales process across a portfolio of over 100 software products. We're transitioning these products to a unified platform based on Salesforce and NetSuite, all while handling complex data imports, modeling divergences and data synchronization.
What we offer: The opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies, including the latest in Angular, AWS serverless and no-code/low-code patterns.The opportunity to learn and experiment with using generative AI to boost your productivity.A team of exceptionally talented engineers from around the world as your peers.The chance to work on products that are making a real difference in people's lives.
We're not just using AI as a buzzword. We're at the start of a thrilling journey with generative AI, experimenting and learning to fully leverage its potential and free our engineers from mundane tasks, allowing them to focus on what truly matters: design, decision-making, and understanding the far-reaching implications of different implementation strategies.Showcase your skills, not just your resume. Take on our challenges: 15-min Cognitive, 90-min Coding, 180-min Technical Decision-Making. Excel and you'll face a decisive interview with our Hiring Manager. More than half walk away with an offer. Ready to unleash your potential? Apply today!What You Will Be Doing Building modern web apps using Angular accompanied by top-notch libraries and tools.Enhancing cloud-native backends using the latest serverless cloud patterns, including AWS.Reviewing code to ensure adherence to best practices, team standards, and customer requirements.
What You Won’t Be Doing Spending time on minor bug fixes or features in outdated codebases.Dealing with tedious infrastructure to keep poorly written products running.Getting stuck in endless meetings discussing roadmaps and priorities or chasing people around.
Basic RequirementsFull Stack Engineer key responsibilities At least 3 years of experience writing frontend code (any framework)At least 1 year of experience writing frontend code in Angular.At least 3 years of experience writing backend code (any framework).An openness to learn to use generative A.I. in your day-to-day development work.
Nice-to-have Requirements Experience in using generative A.I. in your day-to-day development work.
About TrilogyHundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!Working with CrossoverThis is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $50 USD/hour, which equates to $100,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.What to expect next: You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.
Important! If you do not receive an email from us: First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.
Crossover Job Code: LJ-4774-PK-Islamaba-FullStackEngin.005

Job Info:
Crossover  · Lahore, Punjab, Pakistan Reposted  
2 weeks ago
employees: 5,001-10,000 employees · IT Services and IT Consulting
Job Desception:
About the job
            
 
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?Are you a full-stack engineer who thrives on complex challenges and is eager to make a real impact? Join our team to contribute to innovative products that deeply leverage AI and that are reshaping industries and changing the way we work and learn.Our strategic product line includes: Crossover: An AI-powered hiring platform that sifts through millions of applicants per year to find the top 1% of global remote talent, making high-paying jobs accessible to professionals worldwide, regardless of their location.gt.school: An online education platform that uses advanced data collection, algorithms, and AI-generated content to empower students learn at their own pace. Our adaptive learning system fills knowledge gaps, accelerates learning, and helps students quickly master a whole grade level on a subject within weeks.Data-driven Sales: This initiative leverages data and AI algorithms to streamline the sales process across a portfolio of over 100 software products. We're transitioning these products to a unified platform based on Salesforce and NetSuite, all while handling complex data imports, modeling divergences and data synchronization.
What we offer: The opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies, including the latest in Angular, AWS serverless and no-code/low-code patterns.The opportunity to learn and experiment with using generative AI to boost your productivity.A team of exceptionally talented engineers from around the world as your peers.The chance to work on products that are making a real difference in people's lives.
We're not just using AI as a buzzword. We're at the start of a thrilling journey with generative AI, experimenting and learning to fully leverage its potential and free our engineers from mundane tasks, allowing them to focus on what truly matters: design, decision-making, and understanding the far-reaching implications of different implementation strategies.Showcase your skills, not just your resume. Take on our challenges: 15-min Cognitive, 90-min Coding, 180-min Technical Decision-Making. Excel and you'll face a decisive interview with our Hiring Manager. More than half walk away with an offer. Ready to unleash your potential? Apply today!What You Will Be Doing Building modern web apps using Angular accompanied by top-notch libraries and tools.Enhancing cloud-native backends using the latest serverless cloud patterns, including AWS.Reviewing code to ensure adherence to best practices, team standards, and customer requirements.
What You Won’t Be Doing Spending time on minor bug fixes or features in outdated codebases.Dealing with tedious infrastructure to keep poorly written products running.Getting stuck in endless meetings discussing roadmaps and priorities or chasing people around.
Basic RequirementsFull Stack Developer key responsibilities At least 3 years of experience writing frontend code (any framework)At least 1 year of experience writing frontend code in Angular.At least 3 years of experience writing backend code (any framework).An openness to learn to use generative A.I. in your day-to-day development work.
Nice-to-have Requirements Experience in using generative A.I. in your day-to-day development work.
About TrilogyHundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!Working with CrossoverThis is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $50 USD/hour, which equates to $100,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.What to expect next: You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.
Important! If you do not receive an email from us: First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

FixFirst - The OS for Circular Services & Products · Islamabad, Islāmābād, Pakistan

 · 93 applicants
Job Desception:
About the job
            
 
FixFirst is a GreenTech startup that aims to end the throw-away world by making circular services such as repair easy, accessible, and attractive - for everyone.Therefore, we’re building THE Operating System for Circular Services & Products. Our solution is a Software Platform that streamlines workflows & collaboration between 1. circular service providers (for maintenance, repair & refurbishment of electronics & more) & 2. brands (like manufacturers, retailers, cities & insurances). lt further allows them to exchange service capacity & materials like products, spare parts & more for reuse on our Matching Market.Our vision is a world where fixing products comes first and using them longer is the norm. Driven by our mission to accelerate the circularity of the products we already use, we will enable our world to save up to 14 Gt of CO2 by 2030.We believe extending product lifetime with circular services such as repair is the easiest, fastest, and most underrated way to reach our climate goals and thus, to save our planet. 🌍♻️🛠TasksHelp us build a great company: 🏗 Hands-on Knowledge to work on Node js, Mongo DB, Angular js and Express jsArchitect, Develop, test and deploy robust products that are fast, scalable and highly responsiveEstablish, refine and integrate development environment tools and software as neededIdentify production and non-production application issues as a part of the deploymentDeploy applications on AWS cloud with the ability to quickly debug hosting related issues
RequirementsAn impact-driven entrepreneurial mind: 🤓 Computer science or similar studies with completed Bachelor or Master degreeKnowledge of multiple front-end languages and libraries (e.g. HTML/ CSS, JavaScript, XML, jQuery)Highly motivated & attention to detailFluent in English & good communicator
BenefitsThis is the ideal chance to combine an entrepreneurial opportunity with sustainable impact! 🌳📈You will experience everything along the most essential phase of a startup - are you ready to jump on board and do your best in making (y)our vision come true?Based in Berlin, we embrace flexible work next to purpose, fun and growth. Plus, we can offer coaching and company shares!We’re remote first & have an office at the Factory that includes anything from kicker to coffee bar. 😉🎉Just start our application form and include your motivation, CV and professional profile. For remote we're ok with UTC-3 to UTC+5 (Berlin is UTC+1). Please state your preferred location and salary expectations – we’ll be in touch asap! ⏰🙌Cheers and see you soon,Sebastian

2 weeks ago

Job Desception:
About the job
            
 
At Get Licensed, we help people get training, get licensed, and find work, and we do this by leveraging technology to make the whole process as efficient and easy as possible. We operate across several verticals, and we’re looking to expand those verticals to cater to demand in the UK. We've helped more than 300,000 people get licensed and find work and are consistently rated 5-star on Trustpilot with over 24,000 reviews. Get Licensed is a fast-paced technology business at heart (the majority of our team are developers or tech wizards), and we are at an exciting stage of our business, having tripled since 2020. We have ambitious plans to significantly scale our existing business, broaden our product suite, and continue to grow profitably revenue year on year, with a clear roadmap of how we will get there.Job Description:We are looking for an experienced Full Stack Next.js Developer with proficiency in Node.js to join our team. As a Full Stack Developer, you will play a key role in designing, developing, and maintaining web applications using the Next.js framework. Your responsibilities will encompass creating RESTful APIs, integrating with databases, and working extensively with React, Redux, and React Forms handling, as well as implementing authentication using next-auth. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to build robust, scalable, and secure applications.Responsibilities: Develop and maintain web applications using the Next.js framework for both front-end and back-end components.Create RESTful APIs using Node.js, ensuring data flows smoothly between the client and server.Implement user authentication and authorization mechanisms using next-auth.Design and optimize database models and queries for efficient data storage and retrieval.Develop interactive and responsive user interfaces using React and Redux.Handle React Forms for data input and validation, ensuring a seamless user experience.Troubleshoot and debug issues, and optimize application performance.Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code following coding standards.Stay up-to-date with the latest web development trends and technologies.
Requirements: At least 3 years of proven experience as a Full Stack Developer, with a strong focus on Next.js and Node.js.Proficiency in creating RESTful APIs and integrating them with databases.Strong experience in React and Redux for front-end development.Knowledge of React Forms handling for effective data input and validation.Expertise in user authentication and authorization using next-auth.Familiarity with modern front-end tools and build pipelines.Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot and optimize code.Effective communication and collaboration skills to work in a team environment.Dedication to writing clean, well-documented code.Experience working with version control systems (e.g., Git) and collaborative development.
If you are an experienced Full Stack Next.js Developer with a background in Node.js and the qualifications listed above, we encourage you to apply. Join our team and contribute to the development of cutting-edge web applications that offer exceptional performance and user experiences.Expected Behaviours:We are committed to achieving excellence, whilst having fun and being highly curious. We are passionate about hiring fantastic individuals who thrive in an open, fast-paced, and collaborative environment, who are accountable to themselves, take responsibility from day one, and are willing to roll their sleeves up to get stuff done. There are certain behaviors that we expect from our colleagues, and the key ones are set out below. Fundamentally we expect everyone at Get Licensed to Do The Right Thing. We measure performance against these behaviors as part of each employee’s quarterly review: Be empathetic — Be kind and treat others how you would like to be treatedRemain curious — ask questions, continually learn, and strive for betterEmpower people — share your knowledge, lend a helping hand, and make people feel valuedThink big — Think differently, be agile, and act on great ideas quickly – there is always a better way of doing somethingDelivery quality — Work to a standard of which you are proud - be efficient, take ownership, deliver and celebrate successes

Job Info:
Crossover  · Islamabad, Islāmābād, Pakistan Reposted  
1 week ago
employees: 5,001-10,000 employees · IT Services and IT Consulting
Job Desception:
About the job
            
 
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?Are you a full-stack engineer who thrives on complex challenges and is eager to make a real impact? Join our team to contribute to innovative products that deeply leverage AI and that are reshaping industries and changing the way we work and learn.Our strategic product line includes: Crossover: An AI-powered hiring platform that sifts through millions of applicants per year to find the top 1% of global remote talent, making high-paying jobs accessible to professionals worldwide, regardless of their location.gt.school: An online education platform that uses advanced data collection, algorithms, and AI-generated content to empower students learn at their own pace. Our adaptive learning system fills knowledge gaps, accelerates learning, and helps students quickly master a whole grade level on a subject within weeks.Data-driven Sales: This initiative leverages data and AI algorithms to streamline the sales process across a portfolio of over 100 software products. We're transitioning these products to a unified platform based on Salesforce and NetSuite, all while handling complex data imports, modeling divergences and data synchronization.
What we offer: The opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies, including the latest in Angular, AWS serverless and no-code/low-code patterns.The opportunity to learn and experiment with using generative AI to boost your productivity.A team of exceptionally talented engineers from around the world as your peers.The chance to work on products that are making a real difference in people's lives.
We're not just using AI as a buzzword. We're at the start of a thrilling journey with generative AI, experimenting and learning to fully leverage its potential and free our engineers from mundane tasks, allowing them to focus on what truly matters: design, decision-making, and understanding the far-reaching implications of different implementation strategies.Showcase your skills, not just your resume. Take on our challenges: 15-min Cognitive, 90-min Coding, 180-min Technical Decision-Making. Excel and you'll face a decisive interview with our Hiring Manager. More than half walk away with an offer. Ready to unleash your potential? Apply today!What You Will Be Doing Building modern web apps using Angular accompanied by top-notch libraries and tools.Enhancing cloud-native backends using the latest serverless cloud patterns, including AWS.Reviewing code to ensure adherence to best practices, team standards, and customer requirements.
What You Won’t Be Doing Spending time on minor bug fixes or features in outdated codebases.Dealing with tedious infrastructure to keep poorly written products running.Getting stuck in endless meetings discussing roadmaps and priorities or chasing people around.
Basic RequirementsFull Stack Developer key responsibilities At least 3 years of experience writing frontend code (any framework)At least 1 year of experience writing frontend code in Angular.At least 3 years of experience writing backend code (any framework).An openness to learn to use generative AI in your day-to-day development work.
Nice-to-have Requirements Experience in using generative AI in your day-to-day development work.
About TrilogyHundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!Working with CrossoverThis is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $50 USD/hour, which equates to $100,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.What to expect next: You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.
Important! If you do not receive an email from us: First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

Location: Applications from entire Pakistan are welcome.Xgrid Staff Fullstack Developers are skilled and talented professionals, who can design, deploy and test breakthrough software for clouds and data centers. They will have a high customer and product delivery orientation, with the ability to both understand the “big picture” issues AND to drill down to detail.If you are passionate about working with world’s top tech silicon valley companies and highly experienced software engineers, and are excited about solving interesting and complex problems and challenges in a fast paced environment, where you get to not only grow yourself, but also help build a team and culture, Xgrid has a place for you and we would love to have you on board!What you will do Directly interface with customers to understand their requirements, manage customer relationships, and come up with a plan of action independently.Participate in pre-project activities such as estimation of project efforts, project budgeting, preparation of high level project plan with project timeline and resource requirements, and staffing and organization of project team.Design and architect solutions for customer projects, drive end-to-end solution design and delivery across different platforms (web and mobile)Help build, train and grow a team of engineers, readily welcome and implement remote work cultureEstablish team culture and processes around standups, code commits, feedback loopsExecute and implement cloud solutions together with the team (being hands-on is key!)Continuously evaluate team processes and help make them better by regular iterations and improvements and automations, that drive industry best practices with better efficiency across the teamShare team leadership responsibilities, including mentoring, coordinating activities, improving engineering processes, inspiring and motivating others, working as a promoter of new ideas and technology solutions in virtualization, networking, and cloud space.Work with highly experienced silicon valley engineers
